Line 49: Line 49:
==2011 revolution==
==2011 revolution==
  +
[[File:Noor Ayman & Mona Seif.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Nour ([[Ayman Nour]]'s son) & Mona Seif.]]
In 2010, tension between protesters and the regime increased. Mona began attending protests and working to raise awareness. "I actually celebrated my 25th birthday at a demonstration, in front of the ministry of prosecution. My friends were all there and it was very funny," she told CNN.<ref name=cnn/>
In 2010, tension between protesters and the regime increased. Mona began attending protests and working to raise awareness. "I actually celebrated my 25th birthday at a demonstration, in front of the ministry of prosecution. My friends were all there and it was very funny," she told CNN.<ref name=cnn/>
Line 54: Line 55:
==Post-Mubarak==
==Post-Mubarak==
â
[[File:Noor Ayman & Mona Seif.jpg|thumb|Nour ([[Ayman Nour]]'s son) & Mona Seif.]]
+
[[File:Aida Seif El Dawla and Mona Seif.jpg|thumb|Dr. ''Aida Seif El Dawla'' and Mona Seif at the Anti-Torture conference]]
Seif is a member of ''No to Military Trials of Civilians'', a group pushing for the release of those detained during the revolution, the movement of civilians from military courts to trials by a civil judge, and, investigation of torture allegations involving military police.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/467893 |title=Military promises activists it will review military trials of civilians | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14285/Egypt/Politics-/Egypt%E2%80%99s-ruling-military-makes-promises-to-No-to-Mi.aspx |title=Egyptâs ruling military makes promises to No to Military Trials campaigners - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/scaf-promises-to-reconsider-military-trials.html |title=SCAF promises to reconsider military trials |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/2011/06/14/137176946/egypts-secret-military-trials-erode-activists-trust |title=Egypt's Secret Military Trials Erode Activists' Trust |publisher=NPR |date= |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Hennessy |first=Molly |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527,0,5482207.story |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials |publisher=latimes.com |date=2011-05-27 |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref> Seif wrote on her blog ''Ma3t'', about the military police during crackdowns on Tahrir protesters, requesting people come forward with their stories.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/bloggers-slam-army-council-in-anti-scaf-blogging-day.html |title=Bloggers slam army council in anti-SCAF blogging day |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref>
Seif is a member of ''No to Military Trials of Civilians'', a group pushing for the release of those detained during the revolution, the movement of civilians from military courts to trials by a civil judge, and, investigation of torture allegations involving military police.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/467893 |title=Military promises activists it will review military trials of civilians | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14285/Egypt/Politics-/Egypt%E2%80%99s-ruling-military-makes-promises-to-No-to-Mi.aspx |title=Egyptâs ruling military makes promises to No to Military Trials campaigners - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/scaf-promises-to-reconsider-military-trials.html |title=SCAF promises to reconsider military trials |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/2011/06/14/137176946/egypts-secret-military-trials-erode-activists-trust |title=Egypt's Secret Military Trials Erode Activists' Trust |publisher=NPR |date= |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Hennessy |first=Molly |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527,0,5482207.story |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials |publisher=latimes.com |date=2011-05-27 |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref> Seif wrote on her blog ''Ma3t'', about the military police during crackdowns on Tahrir protesters, requesting people come forward with their stories.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/bloggers-slam-army-council-in-anti-scaf-blogging-day.html |title=Bloggers slam army council in anti-SCAF blogging day |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-17}}</ref>
